text: the Red Shoes is a movie about an artist
who sacrifices herself for her
it was made in Britain in 1948 a period
of bleak austerity for a public that was
starved for beauty and it's lost none of
its ravishing power
the beauty of this movie is the product
of an extraordinary collaboration it was
produced written and directed by Emeric
Pressburger and Michael Powell known
collectively as the archers it was shot
in lustrous Technicolor by the great
cinematographer Jack Cardiff the music
was composed by Brian EES Dale and
performed by the Royal Philharmonic
Orchestra the remarkable choreography is
by Robert Helpmann and Lena in my scene
both of whom are seen dancing on screen
the movie tells the story of a dance
company preparing to perform the red
shoes a ballet based on the hands
Christian Andersen fairy tale of the
same name the composer of the ballets
score is Julian Craster played by Marius
goring an ambitious and earnest young
fellow who is discovered by the great
Boris Lermontov the imperious and
cynical impresario of the company the
heart of fire is your work isn't it you

that's why it is worth remembering that
it is much more disheartening to have to

walbrook a gay Jewish refugee from

why do you want to live I don't know

to Lermontov recognizes a fellow devotee

Anderson fairy tale the red shoes take
over whoever puts them on and dances
them to their death in the film they
serve as a metaphor for the obsession
that draws the three main characters
together and also tears them apart
the Red Shoes is a wonderful depiction
of artists at work and a fascinating
examination of the obsessive drive to
create art but what makes it great is
how completely it surrenders itself to
that obsession
